title: 94/768/EC: Commission Decision of 22 November 1994 authorizing the Member States to permit temporarily the marketing of rye seed not satisfying the requirements of Council Directive 66/402/EEC
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 22 November 1994 authorizing the Member States to permit temporarily the marketing of rye seed not satisfying the requirements of Council Directive 66/402/EEC (94/768/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The other Member States are hereby authorized to permit, subject to the conditions laid down in Article 1 and for the purposes intended by the applicant Member State, the marketing in their territory of a maximum of 900 tonnes of rye seed.  The official label shall bear the endorsement referred to in Article 1 (b).

Member States shall notifiy the Commission before 31 January 1995 of the quantities of seed marketed in their territory pursuant to this Decision. The Commission shall inform the other Member States thereof.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 22 November 1994.
For the Commission
RenĂŠ STEICHEN
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No 125, 11. 7. 1966, p. 2309/66.
(2) OJ No L 54, 5. 3. 1993, p. 20.
